text: so I couldn't decide between having uh
slides or doing a demo so I guess I'm
just going to do both hello everyone
welcome to my lightning talk about uh
what I consider the cloud native
community's best kept secret that's
build packs my name is Ram I am part of
the buildpacks community and it's my
absolute pleasure to introduce you to
this uh wonderful piece of technology
that we have as part of the cncf
landscape the original title of this
talk was you know something slightly
more involved the there's there's
definitely a lot of pain points that
people have come to us and spoken about
in terms of how it's getting hard to
maintain Docker files at scale and how
it's hard to prevent developers from
just willingly copying lines from stack
Overflow answers and just committing
them as real Docker files and there's
security issues there's maintenance
issues there's so many things and so the
build packs project is placed squarely
at solving this problem and it's built
on Decades of you know platform
engineering experience for large
organizations and large
Footprints the idea is to help
developers and teams move from code to a
container with as small a barrier as
possible and the buildpacks technology
is essentially a a collection of
programs and scripts so you'll find
build packs written in something like
shell scripts or or you might find a
ruby based build pack or something like
that but it basically moves your code
through a life cycle at the end of which
you'll have a functional container so
the build packs approach is somewhat
distinct to what we are used to in the
docker world the idea of
multi-stage builds which is a rather
Advanced Concept in Docker is something
that comes out of that is available by
default in the build pack word
there's also a lot of security and
compliance use cases that are very
easily addressed by buildpacks because
of its you know pedigree in large scale
systems and big engineering
organizations and things like that
buildpack also has support for some of
the things that the cloud native
Community considers most important uh
Vis observability for example there's a
new Relic build pack there's an Hotel
build pack and things like that and also
it comes with enough hooks for
automation so you can do reproducible
builds and things like that fairly
easily now the future of build packs
contain some important things relating
to Arm based containers and doing better
as bombs for security and things like
that but obviously the focus is on
providing a homogeneous build experience
across different languages and families
now if you are interested in a real
world use case of how build packs can be
used specifically for an mlops vertical
there's a talk tomorrow in the evening
at this very uh stage so please check it

packs Community are giving that talk but
also I'm
available at the project Pavilion in the

come you know stop by get your build
packs questions answered you can argue
about why Docker will continue to amaze

hopefully in the next year maybe 18
